definitions.definition: a trip that you go on for pleasure or education, usually with a group of people and lasting no more than one day

examples.text: We went on an outing to London.
Every year she organized an outing to the countryside.
We're going on an outing tomorrow.
The children were on a day's outing from school.

definitions.definition: an occasion when somebody takes part in a competition
the practice of naming people as gay or lesbian in public, when they would prefer to keep this information private

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘the action of going out or of expelling’): from the verb out + -ing.
